EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.89}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Market Trends on the y-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Inventory on the y-axis?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Property Management and Age or the cell corresponding to Property Management and Size?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Property Management} and {Size} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Appraisal and Age or the cell corresponding to Residential and Market Trends?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Residential} and {Market Trends} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Land and Interest Rates or the cell corresponding to Residential and Supply?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Residential} and {Supply} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.34 to 0.38?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Commercial, Demand), (Development, Demand), (Industrial, Demand), (Land, Demand), (Property Management, Demand), (Residential, Demand)}.
